summary: This document is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel discussing media strategy regarding an upcoming Palm Beach Post article about the Jeffrey Epstein plea deal. It reveals internal discussions about the office's position on the case and mentions key prosecutors involved.

persons.name: Alex
persons.context: Referred to in internal email discussion about the Epstein case; the email author states Alex wanted the case to stay as a state case but with minimum protections for victims.

persons.name: Barry Krischer
persons.context: Mentioned as someone whom Alex (the U.S. Attorney) may have wanted to 'save face' in the handling of the Epstein case.

connections.description: Implied professional relationship where Alex, as U.S. Attorney, considered Barry Krischer's position and potentially wanted him to save face regarding the Epstein case.

events.title: Release of Epstein Article by Palm Beach Post
events.description: The Palm Beach Post is counting down to the release of an article about the Epstein plea deal, prompting internal discussion among prosecutors about media response.

locations: 500 East Broward Boulevard, 7th Floor Ft. Lauderdale, FL 33394
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office was preparing for media inquiries about an upcoming Palm Beach Post article on the Epstein plea deal.
The internal position was that the case started as a state case and they wanted it to remain so, but with minimum protections for victims regarding jail time and compensation.
One prosecutor expressed a personal opinion that U.S. Attorney Alex wanted State Attorney Barry Krischer to 'save face' in the matter.
The email chain shows coordination about directing media calls to a specific spokesperson.
